info.name: API Partners (Public)
info.description:
## ✨ Summary
The Partner API allows **partner software** or **member firms** to retrieve and send information from/to MyUnisoft. The API expose a set of HTTP routes (or endpoints) that will allow you to perform **various tasks and actions** such as:

- Managing the accounting plan
- Pushing accounting entries in different formats (FEC, TRA + PJ, Factur-X, JSON).
- Extracting data (Entries, Balance, Grand livre etc..) 

In order to access this API **you must request** an access to c.mandrilly@myunisoft.fr (CTO)

##  🔬 Access type
Our partner API allows two distinct types of access:

🔸 Restricted access to a **company** (society)

> Limited access per company is the most common model because it allows our solutions to be permanently interconnected by means of a token that has no expiration date (it can nevertheless be revoked by the company manager or by our technical teams).

[A short video on how the connection work with our partner Evoliz](https://vimeo.com/432178505/b1a518283f)

🔹 Access to an entire **cabinet** (firm)

> This access was primarily designed to be used by the firms themselves. The authentication will deliver a token with a very short lifetime to ensure better security.

## 📜 Technical documentation

We have created a complete documentation on our github page accessible [here](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires).

### 🚀 Using a route exposed by the API

When using an exposed route it is necessary to have the **API Token** as a [Bearer token](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/) in the HTTP **Authorization** header (and especially not the User token).

It is also necessary to add a "**X-Third-Party-Secret**" header containing the secret key communicated by our team.

```bash
$ curl --location --request GET 'https://api.myunisoft.fr/api/v1/vat_param' \
--header 'X-Third-Party-Secret: nompartenaire-L8vlKfjJ5y7zwFj2J49xo53V' \
--header 'Authorization: Bearer {{API_TOKEN}}'
```

🔹 For the firm access you may need to add an additional `society-id` header when requesting the API.

### 📉 Ratelimit

The API limits the number of requests per API Token, some additional headers are sent in the HTTP response:

- **X-Rate-Limit-Remaining** (the number of requests remaining in the period).
- **X-Rate-Limit-Reset** (timestamp for when the period will be reset).
- **X-Rate-Limit-Total** (the total number of requests for a period).

The default limit is `100` requests per minute.

item.name: Society Access (Key Management)

response.name: authenticate/user

request.description:
📢 Before you can generate an **API Token** it will be necessary to get your partner ID. This endpoint allows you to recover the `id` thanks to your "**X-Third-Party**" key!

This id will be necessary for the "**grantedFor**" field in the next API call `key/create`.

> The `X-Third-Party-Secret` key is provided by the MyUnisoft technical team

response.name: key/granted-for

request.description:
📢 This route allows the creation of a key (or API Token)
- grantedFor: the id of the partner you want to access and which will be linked to the Token API. Retrieved with the granted-for route.
- target: the id of the company that will be linked to the token API. It is possible to retrieve the id of a company through the MyUnisoft application (the id will be present in the URL).

This endpoint require a User Bearer token as authorization header. Guide on [our github documentation](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/blob/main/docs/auth/user.md)

response.name: key/create
response.body:
{
    "id": "f75c3265-65f8-4417-9056-f285698eef5f",
    "target": 2,
    "grantedBy": 1,
    "grantedFor": 1,
    "value": "{{JWT-TOKEN-HERE}}"
}

request.description: 📢 List of accessible and authorized HTTP endpoints with your access.

response.name: key/info

item.description:
If you are a partner it may be necessary to generate a key to work with a MyUnisoft company.

Note that it is not necessary to generate the keys in question yourself once in production. Collaborators will be able to generate a key themselves in our partners integration view.

Example with Evoliz:
![](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/raw/main/docs/images/connector_tab_evoliz.PNG)

> ⚠️ This step is not required for production and doesn't work with a "Cabinet" (Firm) access.

item.name: Cabinet/Firm Access

request.description:
📢 Endpoint to authenticate with a Firm/cabinet access. Will return an API Token.

A numeric property `firm` can be added to the body for accounts with access to multiple entities/schemas.

In the MyUnisoft interface it is possible to retrieve the id of the entity through the menu `Tenue` > `Liens dynamiques`. It will be enough to retrieve the "schema number".

![](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/raw/main/docs/images/liens_dynamique.PNG)

response.name: authenticate/firm

request.description:
📢 Get/fetch the list of users. Physical persons should not be confused with users. A user can be a physical person but the reverse is not necessarily true.

From a technical point of view, a user is first and foremost someone who has access to the MyUnisoft solution (and more specifically to the firm).

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access**

response.name: users_v2

request.description:

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access**

request.description:
📢 Get/fetch the list of wallets (portefeuilles). Each wallet is related to a list of companies and users.

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access**

response.name: wallets (portefeuilles)

request.description:
📢 Get/fetch the configuration/formules used for each company (dossier).

Preaccounting (**preaccounting_id**):

| id | label | code |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Evoliz Smoothie | ESMOO |
| 2 | Evoliz Caisse | ECAI |
| 3 | Evoliz Banana Split | EBAN |
| 4 | Aucun | AUCU |

Employee application (**employee_app_id**):

| id | label | code |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Coffre fort uniquement | COFF |
| 2 | Weekera (NDF, abs + coffre) | WEEK |
| 3 | Aucun | AUCU |

MyUnisoft formule (**formula_myun_id**):

| id | label | code |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Light | LIGHT |
| 2 | Standard | STAN |
| 3 | Duo | DUO |
| 4 | Business | BUSI |
| 5 | Light + One | LONE |
| 6 | Standard + One | SONE |
| 7 | Premium | PREM |
| 8 | MyDataRH uniquement | MYDA |
| 9 | Inactif | INAC |
| 10 | One | ONEE |

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access**

response.name: dashboard modules (admin EC)

request.description:
📢 Fetch the list of companies (dossiers) which are under the responsibility of the connected firm.

⚠️ If you provide a `society-id` header it will only return information on the given company/society.

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access**

request.description:
📢 Get a company information (such as the id) by providing the Reference.

⚠️ In MyUnisoft two or more companies may have the same Reference code. For this particular case an Error will be throw.

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access**

response.name: search company by Reference

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.

request.description:
📢 Fetch the list of review (dossiers de révision).

⚠️ `society-id` header is required **with a cabinet (firm) access**.

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access.**

response.name: dossier revision list

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.

response.name: get one review

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.
Required if you're using a firm access.

query.description:
REQUIRED - To get all cycles or a selected cycle.
- All cycles: -1
- One cycle: (le code/label du cycle?)

request.description:
📢 Fetch the list of cycles from a selected review (dossier de révision/modèle de révision).

⚠️ `society-id` header is required **with a cabinet (firm) access**.

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access.**

response.name: dossier revision cycle

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.

query.description:
REQUIRED - To get all cycles or a selected cycle.
- All cycles: -1
- One cycle: (le code/label du cycle?)

- All my folders = 1

- OCR only = 3

request.description:
📢Get OCR follow up/tracking (suivi OCR).

⚠️ If you provide a `society-id` header it will only return information on the given company/society.

📌 **This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access.**

response.name: Suivi OCR

header.description: ⚠️ If you provide a society-id header it will only return information on the given company/society.

query.description: REQUIRED - Request Mode : 1 (All my folders)   2 (All sent by me)  3 (OCR only)

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.

query.description: OPTIONAL - grouped or ungrouped (Retrives all by default)

item.description:
Endpoints restricted to Firm/Cabinet access. Those endpoints allow to fetch information on:

- The list of companies (dossiers)
- The list of users (who have an access to the platform) and physical person

item.name: Import (Entries & Documents)

request.description:
📢 Create an accounting entry. Please check the entry/temp route for an example of payload to send in the body of the request.

> 👀 Complete documentation with TypeScript interface and JSON Schema [here](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/blob/main/docs/entry_json.md).

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

📢 Create a "Facture(s) en attente(s)" accounting entry. Those entries **need to be validated** by a collaborator.

![](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/blob/main/docs/images/saisie_location.PNG?raw=true)

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

query.description: Required 1 = Achat / 2 = Note de frais / 3 = Vente / 4 = Avoir

request.description:
📢 Send a Factur-X PDF.

> Note: BT-3 field is not yet internaly supported and that's why `invoice_type_id` must be completed.

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

📢 Import entries with the TRA + PJ Archive format.

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

response.name: TRA/partial

query.description:
0 = check if there is entries on the exercise (returns an error message),  
1 = no verification, the data is added to the existing exercise,   
2 = we delete the entries if present on the exercise.

request.description:
📢 Import with FEC format (doesn't support adding a document/PJ). This endpoint require a valid exercice id.

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

query.description: Required 1 = Achat / 2 = Note de frais / 3 = Vente / 4 = Avoir
Required / 2 = MANUEL / 3 = OCR MyUnisoft / 5 = OCR Premium / 6 = Factur-X

request.description:
📢 Sending an image or PDF for OCR processing. It is also possible to force a send on the Flux manuel.

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

📢 Add an attachment (PJ or **pièce jointe**) to an existing entry.

![](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/raw/main/docs/images/pj.PNG)

The location must be ENTRIES or ENTRIES_TEMP (depending on how the entry has been created).

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.

request.description:
📢Sending bank statements/EBICS files.

**Duplicated entries will be ignored.**

⚠️ `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

📌**This endpoint only work with a cabinet (firm) access.**

header.description: Required if you're using a firm access.

item.description: All endpoints to import entries and documents (which will be transformed into an accounting entry).

query.description:
0 =  export à base de ID_EXERCICE  
1 = export à base de DATE DEBUT * DATE FIN

Required. 
E = ECRITURE,
O = ECRITURE OCR,
IB = ECRITURE INTEGRATION BANCAIRE,
M = ECRITURE  MANUEL,
EXT = ECRITURE EXTOURNE,
L = ECRITURE LETTRAGE

request.description:
📢 Retrieve active and pending entries:

- **E** (ECRITURE)
- **O** (ECRITURE OCR/ECRITURE EN ATTENTE)
- **IB** (ECRITURE INTEGRATION BANCAIRE)
- **M** (ECRITURE MANUEL)
- **EXT** (ECRITURE EXTOURNE)
- **L** (ECRITURE LETTRAGE)

> 👀 Complete TypeScript interface [here](https://github.com/MyUnisoft/api-partenaires/blob/main/docs/ecritures.md)

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

response.name: Entries (JSON)

query.description:
Required. 
E = ECRITURE,
O = ECRITURE OCR,
IB = ECRITURE INTEGRATION BANCAIRE,
M = ECRITURE  MANUEL,
EXT = ECRITURE EXTOURNE,
L = ECRITURE LETTRAGE

item.name: entry/id (Fetch entry by a partner ID)

query.description: Optionnal date ranges but if it's activated start_date and end_date must be filled
Optionnal Column and direction of sorting results by (Columns : credit,debit,date,label,lettrage,piece,piece2      direction: asc,desc)

Optionnal Filter if filled could be true (entries filtered by lettering not empty) or false (entries filtered by lettering empty)
If lettering param not filled all entries are retrieved

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

query.description: OPTIONAL - Retrieves accounts where the account number starts with begin_by.

request.description:
📢 Fetch all the accounts (suppliers, customers, etc) of the accounting plan (plan comptable).

If `begin_by` is supplied, only accounts whose the account number starts with `begin_by` will be returned.

This way, you can find an account with its account number.

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

query.description:
OPTIONAL - Retrieves:
- accounts where the account label includes "q".
- accounts where the account number starts with "q".

request.description:
📢 Fetch all accounts and returns a simplified view of them.

If `q` is supplied, only accounts whose the account label includes `q` and accounts whose the account number starts with `q` will be returned.

This way, you can find an account with its account number and its label.

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access.

response.name: Simplified accounts (all accounts)

query.description:
OPTIONAL - Retrieves:
- accounts where the account label includes "q".
- accounts where the account number starts with "q".

⚠️ The use of the `society-id` is optional with a firm access.

request.description:
📢 List of diaries (journaux).

- The name property can be updated and should not be used as a constraint key.
- Some diary have an account like Bank (To define to which bank the accounting entries should be attached).

| id | label | traduction | code |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Achat | Purchase | ACH |
| 2 | Vente | Sale | VTE |
| 3 | Banque | Bank | BQ |
| 4 | Caisse | - | CAISSE |
| 5 | OD | Various operations | OD |
| 6 | OD Audit | - | OD_AUDIT |
| 7 | OD Simulation | - | OD_SIMUL |
| 8 | À extourner | To be extorted | A_EXT |
| 9 | Extourne | - | EXT |
| 10 | À Nouveaux | - | AN |
| 11 | OD Paie | OD Payroll | OD_PAIE |
| 12 | OD Lettrage | - | OD_LET |
| 13 | Note de frais | Expense report | NDF |
| 14 | OD TVA | OD VAT | OD_DECL_FISCALE |

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access

request.description:
📢 Company (dossier) VAT parameters

> Note: DED mean **Deductible** and COLL mean **Collected**

VAT type:

| id | label |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Bien et service |
| 2 | Immobilisation |
| 3 | Auto-liquidation |
| 4 | non soumis |
| 5 | import/export |

Type of Exigibility

| id | label |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Débit (facturation) |
| 2 | Encaissement / Décaissement |
| 3 | Mixte |

⚠️ A `society-id` is required with a cabinet/firm access
